channel.title: Supervisions on Henrik Røed Sherling
channel.description: Recent content in Supervisions on Henrik Røed Sherling

item.title: Ethics
item.description: 1 Practical reason Choose one question: ‘If people’s reasons for action depend on their desires, then people without at least some desire to be good have no reason to be good. So, people’s reasons for action don’t depend on their desires.’ Is this a good argument? ‘You are obligated to $\varphi$ only if you have reason to $\varphi$. You have reason to $\varphi$ only if you are motivated to $\varphi$. You are not motivated to $\varphi$; therefore, you are not obligated to $\varphi$.

item.title: Philosophy of Economics
item.description: This paper is with HPS. As such, there is a standardised supervision guide for all students, which can be found either by asking your supervisor or by consulting Moodle.

item.title: Philosophy of Mind
item.description: 1 Intentionality Question: Do thermostats have beliefs? Required reading: Dennett, ‘Intentional systems’ Searle, ‘Minds, Brains, and Computers’ Haugeland, ‘Understanding: Dennett and Searle’ 2 Consciousness Question: Can science explain consciousness? Required reading: Thomas Nagel, ‘What is it like to be a bat?’ Frank Jackson, ‘Epiphenomenal Qualia’ Chalmers, The Conscious Mind (ch. 3) 3 Knowledge about the mind Choose a question: Do we have privileged access to our own minds? Is introspection reliable?
